member.summary: This function sends a block of data on EMH either as a broadcast (no destination username) or to a specific user (as specified) on the group name supplied. The message can be encrypted and flagged as an image if required
member.param: The block of data (binary or ASCII) to be sent
The length of the data block supplied in
The destination user for the message if being sent point to point, or empty string if being broadcast
The group name or channel name for the message to be sent on
A flag to indicate if this message should be encrypted before sending
A flag to indicate if this message is an image message, which is needed for some users to be received before any updates will be sent
A client supplied message token that will be attached to the messageto identify this in the system
member.returns: This function returns the number of bytes sent, zero if the send failed

member.summary: This function sends a block of data on EMH either as a broadcast (no destination username) or to a specific user (as specified) on the group name supplied. The message can be encrypted and flagged as an image if required
member.param: The block of data (binary or ASCII) to be sent
The length of the data block supplied in

The group name or channel name for the message to be sent on
A flag to indicate if this message should be encrypted before sending
A flag to indicate if this message is an image message, which is needed for some users to be received before any updates will be sent
Will be set to the actual number of bytes that have been sent, after compression and including the protocol overhead
member.returns: This function returns the message token to identify this message on the system, will be guarenteed unique in the system for one hour. If this send fails it return zero

member.name: M:ClientAPI.COrderDataStore.UnregisterAccountInterest(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function removes an interest in account order events for a known account identifier
member.param: The EasyRouter account identifier the client is requesting orders for
member.remarks: No permission checks are done with this function as closing a channel that was not opened will have no effect and they were permissioned when attempting to open the channel

member.name: M:ClientAPI.COrderDataStore.RegisterAccountInterest(System.Int32,ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: Registers this account data store to receive order events for a known account identifier
member.param: The EasyRouter account identifier the client is requesting orders for
The user information object that contains the user details that is making the request
member.returns: This function returns True if the channel interest was opened, otherwise it returns False
member.remarks: To ensure clients are only requesting orders for accounts they have permissions on this function will check the account identifier is already known to the account data store, any failure (such as passing an invalid user info object) to find the account identifier will result in no action in this function and result of false to be returned. Server side users may pass a null _userInfo object into this parameter as they are authorised to request all accounts.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.COrderDataStore.EnrichOrderItem(ClientAPI.COrderItem)
member.summary:
Takes a object, finds a structure item based on the Mnemonic property on the object, and adds the following fields if not already set on the COrderItem:
ESTickerSymbol
SecurityExchange
ESExchange
Symbol
SecurityType
CFICode
StrategyCode
ESDecimalPlaces Additionally, if the StrategyCode is not set, this is considered to be an outright, and the following will also be enhanced:
ESCombinedCommodityCode
ESClearingHouse
RiskArrays In addition, for clients that have a structure item or an account item cached, there are EnrichFromStructure|Account functions on the Place/Edit/Cancel wrappers (which are actually also called by the EnrichOrderItem internally).
member.returns: Returns true if the Mnemonic was found and enhancement attempted.

member.name: T:ClientAPI.COrderDataStore
member.summary: This data store is responsible for the submission of order requests and the processing of order updates as they arrive. It deals with all orders for all accounts. Users are expected to register to receive order events via the account item event interface. This will register for the events on this data store but means the end user can receive the event notifications with the account item context instead of needing to do a separate lookup based on the order item fields. This data store does expose an event interface in case the end user is not interested in the accounts details but needs to see all orders for this connection. Due to the capability to share accounts across users in EasyRouter accessing the order events via the account item events would mean the front end application receives the same order event for each account item instance that exists and will need to handle this design feature. The order hierarchy is set such that the OrderItem that is returned is always the current overall state of any given order. The OrderItem contains a collection of OrderEventItems, one for every event that is received for the order over its lifetime. The OrderEventItem is built based on the contents of an update to the order and the OrderItem updates its order properties based on these changes. Therefore any implementation need only view the current order properties to see the current state of an order but can also query the OrderItem for the full list of events if these are needed. Updates to the order item cannot occur while within the event handler for an order item therefore the order item given in the event can be deemed thread safe, although if the item were cached by a front end application these value might be changed without protection. Therefore it is recommended the event is processed and the item is not cached between events.

member.name: P:ClientAPI.COrderItem.EventESCustomerData
member.summary: This property exposes the ESCustomerData field value for the event that has been received. This is exposed as a seperate field from the ESCustomerData field of the order item to allow for external order modification that would result in an order event being triggered without this value being set, or being set with the external applications own reference in here. In which case the client can still access the value set in the ESCustomerData field. If the event requires the ESCustomerData field to be updated to a new value the application must be this.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.SetStaticConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the configuration string that will be used to configure the clientapi, which will be taken as static and not replaced by any users permissions
member.param: The XML formatted configuration string to be used for connection details and permissions

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RemoveUserInfo(ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: Takes a parameter, and if found in the internal Username dictionary the entry will be removed. This must be called by clients which are managing their own CUserInfo logon if they are going to attempt to create a new object per logon, as the existing object will be tied to the Username and so any new object with the same name will be rejected. It is perfectly valid to keep the object and simply reuse it if the existing committed name is acceptable, although this pattern is not anticipated to be used much â€“ the anticipated pattern is instantiation of a new CUserInfo object per logon attempt, using it as the backing data store for a bound form.
member.param: The user information object to be removed if found
member.returns: Returns True if the details were found and removed from the collection

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.GetUserInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the user's information from the underlying store, located by the supplied user name
member.param: The username to get the information for
member.returns: The object with the first users information or null if no details exist

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.GetUserInfo
member.summary: Gets the first user's information from the underlying store, if any exist
member.returns: The object with the first users information or null if no details exist

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.GetActiveSessionsCount
member.summary: Get the number of active user sessions remaining via this instance
member.returns: The number of active sessions remaining

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.GetCommunicationsStateObj
member.summary: Gets the state holding object that holds the state information for the communication layer
member.returns: This method returns the object that holds the state information for the communications layer.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.GetCommunicationsState
member.summary: Gets the current communication state value
member.returns: Returns the current communications state expressed as a value from the enumeration

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.SendClientHeartBeat(ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: This method takes a as a parameter which contains the user information and formats a heartbeat protocol message of that user and sends this. Calling this method frequently (approx every 30 seconds) should avoid the users session being marked as stale within EasyRouter.
member.param: The details that is having a heartbeat sent for it

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.SendClientHeartBeat(System.String)
member.summary: This method takes the EasyRouter username as a parameter and formats a heartbeat protocol message of that user and sends this. Calling this method frequently (approx every 30 seconds) should avoid the users session being marked as stale within EasyRouter.
member.param: The username that is having a heartbeat sent for it

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestDisconnect
member.summary: This method will send a Disconnect message object into the routing layer. This method is asynchronous and completion will be notified by the event signalling the connection state as false.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestConnect
member.summary: This method will create and send a Connect message object to the routing layer, if the configuration settings have changed since the last call to Connect these will be sent with the message as well. This method is asynchronous and completion will be signalled by the business object by invoking the if/when the connection state is changed.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestLogoff(ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: This method will format and send a logoff request to the routing layer for a given user. This method is asynchronous and completion will be done by firing the event. The current session information will also be reset for the username in question.
member.param: A object contain the user details for the logoff request
member.returns: This function returns True if the request was formatted and sent successfully to the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestLogoff(System.String)
member.summary: This method will format and send a logoff request to the routing layer for a given user. This method is asynchronous and completion will be done by firing the event. The current session information will also be reset for the username in question.
member.param: The username to be logged off
member.returns: This function returns True if the request was formatted and sent successfully to the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestLogon(ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: This method will format a logon request for a given user and then send this on to the Routing Layer. The method is asynchronous and completion will be signalled by firing the event indicating the success or failure of the request.
member.param: A object contain the user details for the logon request
member.returns: This function returns True if the request was formatted and sent successfully to the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestLogon(System.String)
member.summary: This method will format a logon request for a given user and then send this on to the Routing Layer. The method is asynchronous and completion will be signalled by firing the event indicating the success or failure of the request.
member.param: The username to be requested
member.returns: This function returns True if the request was formatted and sent successfully to the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestPreConnectAuth(ClientAPI.CUserInfo)
member.summary: This method will attempt to authenticate the userâ€™s details with the web server and if successful will receive the set of connection details and other configuration values for this user. The function is asynchronous and returns true or false to indicate the ability to pass the request on to the routing layer. When this request completes the business object fires the event when complete to indicate success or failure of the request.
member.param: The object containing all the user details required for a logon attempt
member.returns: Returns True if the request was passed on to the routing layer successfully

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore.RequestPreConnectAuth(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method will attempt to authenticate the userâ€™s details with the web server and if successful will receive the set of connection details and other configuration values for this user. The function is asynchronous and returns true or false to indicate the ability to pass the request on to the routing layer. When this request completes the business object fires the event when complete to indicate success or failure of the request.
member.param: The EasyRouter username used for authentication
The logon password
The web server URL to used to authenticate the user credentials
TBD
TBD
Flag to indicate if the logon should override any existing active session found for the given user
member.returns: Returns True if the request was passed on to the routing layer successfully

member.name: T:ClientAPI.CStatusDataStore

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.DeleteMessages(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List`1{System.String})
member.summary:
Invokes a service method asynchronously that deletes a persisted piece of data from the server permanently.
The result of the request is returned to the client asynchronously via the event.
member.param: The categoryname () that the message belongs to.
The id () that identifies the message within the .

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.GetMessageList(System.String)
member.summary:
Invokes a service method asynchronously that returns a set of persisted data messages identical to the result from .
Returns a list of persisted data definitions () that DO NOT CONTAIN THE MESSAGE BODY (. In other words we return a list of headlines about messages that we can then request message details for via a request for specific messages through the method.
This method will return whilst an asynchronous request is made and the response will be returned through
member.param: The name of the category to get message headlines for.
member.remarks:
Calls the GetMessagesList method of the Persistence service.
NOTE: THIS METHOD HAS NOT YET BEEN IMPLEMENTED IN THE SERVICE LAYER BUT WILL BE NEEDED.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.GetMessages(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List`1{System.String})
member.summary:
Invokes a service method asynchronously that returns a list of all persisted data messages associated with the calling user and the that is passed in restricted to messages identified by the message keys ( ) that are specified in .
This method will return whilst an asynchronous request is made and the response will be returned through
The result of this call is returned to the client via the event.
member.param: The name of the category that all persisted messages are to be returned for.
List of the s that identify the message set that is to be returned.
member.remarks:
Calls the GetMessages(String^, List<String^>^) method of the Persistence service.
NOTE: THIS METHOD HAS NOT YET BEEN IMPLEMENTED IN THE SERVICE LAYER BUT WILL BE NEEDED.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.GetMessages(System.String)
member.summary:
Invokes a service method asynchronously that returns a list of all persisted data messages associated with the calling user and the that is passed in.
This method will return whilst an asynchronous request is made and the response will be returned through
The result of this call is returned to the client via the event.
member.param: The name of the category that all persisted messages are to be returned for.
member.remarks: Calls the GetMessages(String^) method of the Persistence service.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.PersistMessage(EasyScreen.SOA2.GenericPersistence.PersistedMessageDataContract,System.ValueType!System.Guid!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsBoxed)
member.summary:
Called to persist a piece of information to EasyRouter through the generic data Persistence service.
This method will return whilst an asynchronous request is made and the response will be returned through
member.param: The message that is to be persisted.

An id that is provided by the client application that follows the message throughout the service processing. This is to be used to allow users to tie asyncrhonous responses through .
Within the ClientAPI this should be used to populate the appropriate field within the SOAP header and read back from this field when a response is received from the service architecture.
member.remarks: Calls the CreateMessage method of the Persistence service.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.IPersistence.RefreshCategories
member.summary:
Causes ClientAPI to attempt to refresh its its of categories as exposed through .
This method will return whilst an asynchronous request is made and the response will be returned through

member.summary: This returns a list of the categories that are available for the client to store persisted information in. The object returned will be either of type if we are unavailable to retrieve the list, or a List<^>

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CStructureDataStore.FireInstrumentLookupResponseEvent(System.Object,System.String)
member.remarks: PAW 22 Jun 2010 - Return an object here. We can't overload the event declaration and its fairly standard within WPF GUIs to evaluate the success of responses based on the type of the object that is passed, so we will either return a DataRequestResponse for a success of an ESFault for a failure here. We also need to return the messsageId which is the Id used within the SOAP header of the request and response message to identify the message and its response.

member.name: M:CRoutingThread.RunThread
member.summary: Runs the main thread

member.name: P:ClientAPI.CEventWrapperMarketDataItem.LastTradeHistory
member.summary: An ordered list of Last Trade events which have been received since the last synchronous event invocation. The earliest trade is first in the list, the latest trade is last. If the only item of interest is the Last Trade then use of the GetMarketDataEntry on the MarketDataItem is probably simpler. Elements in the list are created for the event, and will not be changed after creation, so can be safetly used asynchronously if the client knows all the places they are planning no accessing the elements.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.UnregisterChannelInterest(ClientAPI.EDataType,ClientAPI.EComponentType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function removes the business objects interest in a specific channel name as supplied by its constituent parts
member.param: The channel type that be used to trigger events on for the received data
The for this channel type
The that describes the unqiue part of the channel interest
The that describes the group part of the channel interest, usually denotes the security exchange

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.RegisterChannelInterest(ClientAPI.EDataType,ClientAPI.EComponentType,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong)
member.summary: This function registers a business object in a specific channel name, with the channel properties and the sets the response data type for events on this channel.
member.param: The channel type that be used to trigger events on for the received data
The for this channel type
The that describes the unqiue part of the channel interest
The that describes the group part of the channel interest, usually denotes the security exchange
The properties of the new channel interest, use 1 for image or 0 for updates only
member.example: To open an interest for orders for a specific account id of 23 from LIFFE and receive an image supply the following arguments: eChannelDataType=EDataType::eDataTypeOrder, eCompType=EComponentType::eComponentTypeOrders, strUnique="23", strGroup="L", dwChannelProperties=1
member.remarks: See the ClientAPI documentation for more details on channel name building

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.UnregisterDataInterest(ClientAPI.EDataType)
member.summary: This function takes a type parameter and unregisters the business object from receiving events of that data type.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.RegisterDataInterest(ClientAPI.EDataType)
member.summary: This function takes a data type parameter and registers the business object in receiving events for that data type.
member.param: The data type that the business object is interested in, can be any of enumerated values

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.RouteMessageDirect(CMessageObject*)
member.summary: This method will be used by to send a into the routing layer for distribution. This method would be used over the other RouteMessage function when requiring to send the message without queuing the request for processing, it will be processed directly instead
member.param: The to be sent to the communications layer
member.returns: The function returns True if the message was successfully sent via the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.RouteMessage(CMessageObject*)
member.summary: This method will be used by all business objects to send a into the routing layer for distribution. The message is queued for processing and the method returns immediately
member.param: The to be sent to the communications layer
member.returns: The function returns True if the message was successfully sent via the routing layer

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.Uninitialise
member.summary: All business objects will need to override this method to do their own clean up, and then call the base version to allow it to clean up the base template objects.

member.name: M:ClientAPI.CBusinessObjectBase.Initialise(ClientAPI.CManagement)
member.summary: All business objects will need to override this method to do their own forms of initialisation and then call the base version to allow it to set up the base template objects. It will take a reference to a management business object that will be cached internally for use to access data store objects. The management object will take a null pointer here to avoid cyclic references.
member.param: The management singleton object
